intro: Trigonostemon elmeri, commonly known as Elmer's trigonostemon, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its distinctive triangular-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are often clustered in cyathia, typical of the Euphorbiaceae family. It thrives in moist, tropical environments and is often found in lowland forests. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists.
